verses.kjv: But it came to pass within a while after, in the time of wheat harvest, that Samson visited his wife with a kid; and he said, I will go in to my wife into the chamber. But her father would not suffer him to go in.
verses.ct: Some time later, during the wheat harvest, Samson went to visit his wife, bringing a young goat as a gift. He said, "I'm going to my wife in her room." But her father refused to let him in.

verses.kjv: And her father said, I verily thought that thou hadst utterly hated her; therefore I gave her to thy companion: is not her younger sister fairer than she? take her, I pray thee, instead of her.
verses.ct: Her father said, "I was completely sure that you despised her, so I gave her to your best man. But her younger sister is even more attractive — take her instead, please."

verses.kjv: And Samson said concerning them, Now shall I be more blameless than the Philistines, though I do them a displeasure.
verses.ct: Samson responded, "This time I can't be blamed for what I do to the Philistines, because they brought this on themselves."

verses.kjv: And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, and took firebrands, and turned tail to tail, and put a firebrand in the midst between two tails.
verses.ct: So Samson went out and caught 300 foxes. He tied them together in pairs by their tails and fastened a torch between each pair of tails.

verses.kjv: And when he had set the brands on fire, he let them go into the standing corn of the Philistines, and burnt up both the shocks, and also the standing corn, with the vineyards and olives.
verses.ct: Then he lit the torches and released the foxes into the Philistines' grain fields. The fire destroyed both the harvested grain and the standing crops, along with their vineyards and olive groves.

verses.kjv: Then the Philistines said, Who hath done this? And they answered, Samson, the son in law of the Timnite, because he had taken his wife, and given her to his companion. And the Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.
verses.ct: The Philistines demanded, "Who did this?" They were told, "Samson, the son-in-law of the man from Timnah — because the man took Samson's wife and gave her to his best man." So the Philistines went and burned the woman and her father to death.

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto them, Though ye have done this, yet will I be avenged of you, and after that I will cease.
verses.ct: Samson told them, "Since you've done something like this, I won't stop until I've gotten my revenge on you."

verses.kjv: And he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he went down and dwelt in the top of the rock Etam.
verses.ct: He struck them down completely in a devastating attack. Then he went down and stayed in a cave at the rock of Etam.

verses.kjv: Then the Philistines went up, and pitched in Judah, and spread themselves in Lehi.
verses.ct: The Philistines marched up and set up camp in Judah, spreading out near Lehi.

verses.kjv: And the men of Judah said, Why are ye come up against us? And they answered, To bind Samson are we come up, to do to him as he hath done to us.
verses.ct: The men of Judah asked, "Why have you come to attack us?" They replied, "We've come to capture Samson and pay him back for what he did to us."

verses.kjv: Then three thousand men of Judah went to the top of the rock Etam, and said to Samson, Knowest thou not that the Philistines are rulers over us? what is this that thou hast done unto us? And he said unto them, As they did unto me, so have I done unto them.
verses.ct: So 3,000 men from Judah went down to the cave at the rock of Etam and said to Samson, "Don't you realize the Philistines rule over us? What have you done to us?" He answered, "I only did to them what they did to me."

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, We are come down to bind thee, that we may deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines. And Samson said unto them, Swear unto me, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.
verses.ct: They told him, "We've come to tie you up and hand you over to the Philistines." Samson said to them, "Promise me that you won't kill me yourselves."

verses.kjv: And they spake unto him, saying, No; but we will bind thee fast, and deliver thee into their hand: but surely we will not kill thee. And they bound him with two new cords, and brought him up from the rock.
verses.ct: They spoke to him and said, "No, we won't kill you. We'll just tie you up securely and hand you over to them." So they tied him with 2 new ropes and brought him up from the rock.

verses.kjv: And when he came unto Lehi, the Philistines shouted against him: and the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him, and the cords that were upon his arms became as flax that was burnt with fire, and his bands loosed from off his hands.
verses.ct: When he arrived at Lehi, the Philistines came rushing toward him with shouts. But the Spirit of the LORD surged over him with power, and the ropes on his arms became like burned thread, and the bindings fell right off his hands.

verses.kjv: And he found a new jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.
verses.ct: He spotted a fresh jawbone of a donkey, reached out and grabbed it, and killed 1,000 men with it.

verses.kjv: And Samson said, With the jawbone of an ass, heaps upon heaps, with the jaw of an ass have I slain a thousand men.
verses.ct: Then Samson declared, "With the jawbone of a donkey, piles upon piles — with the jawbone of a donkey I have killed 1,000 men."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand, and called that place Ramathlehi.
verses.ct: When he finished speaking, he threw the jawbone aside. He named that place Ramath-lehi.

verses.kjv: And he was sore athirst, and called on the LORD, and said, Thou hast given this great deliverance into the hand of thy servant: and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?
verses.ct: He became extremely thirsty and cried out to the LORD, "You have given your servant this incredible victory, but now am I going to die of thirst and be captured by these uncircumcised people?"

verses.kjv: But God clave an hollow place that was in the jaw, and there came water thereout; and when he had drunk, his spirit came again, and he revived: wherefore he called the name thereof Enhakkore, which is in Lehi unto this day.
verses.ct: So God split open a hollow place in the ground at Lehi, and water flowed out of it. After Samson drank, his strength returned and he was revived. That is why he named it En-hakkore, and it remains in Lehi to this day.

verses.kjv: And he judged Israel in the days of the Philistines twenty years.
verses.ct: Samson led Israel for 20 years during the time of the Philistines.
